body: This was a necessary change because `attr::a` and `attr::b` don't exist (register_prim_ops doesn't inject symbols into aten_interned_strings). I think this rename makes more sense because one can do `torch.add(other=1, self=tensor)` in python land.
body_html: This was a necessary change because attr::a and attr::b don't exist (register_prim_ops doesn't inject symbols into aten_interned_strings). I think this rename makes more sense because one can do torch.add(other=1, self=tensor) in python land.
body_text: This was a necessary change because attr::a and attr::b don't exist (register_prim_ops doesn't inject symbols into aten_interned_strings). I think this rename makes more sense because one can do torch.add(other=1, self=tensor) in python land.
